str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To deceive thoroughly. From ek and apatao; to seduce wholly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
No one, none, nothing.
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Defection, apostasy, revolt. Feminine of the same as apostasion; defection from truth.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Lawlessness, iniquity, disobedience, sin. From anomos; illegality, i.e. Violation of law or wickedness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Destruction, ruin, loss, perishing; eternal ruin. From a presumed derivative of apollumi; ruin or loss.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.
